snippet.title: A postal vote plebiscite is a bad idea, just ask Malcolm Turnbull
snippet.content: As reports suggest the Turnbull government is seriously considering a postal vote on marriage equality, an article written by Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull in 1997 shows that he was once opposed to postal votes. Turnbull was adamantly against a proposed postal vote on a constitutional convention for an Australian republic, saying it "flies in the face of Australian democratic values".
